Class WebServer

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static WebServer getInstance(int port)
        Gets an instance of a web server running on the specified port. If an instance is not already available, a new one is created.
        Parameters:
        port - HTTP port number.

      • getInstance

        public static WebServer getInstance(int port,
                                    java.lang.String ip)
        Gets an instance of a web server running on the specified port. If an instance is not already available, a new one is created.
        Parameters:
        port - HTTP port number.
        ip - IP address to bind HTTP server to.

      • hasInstance

        public static boolean hasInstance(int port)
        Checks if an instance of a web server is running on the specified port.
        Parameters:
        port - HTTP port number.
        Returns:
        true if running, false otherwise.

      • getInstances

        public static WebServer[] getInstances()
        Gets all web server instances running.
        Returns:
        array of web server instances.

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        Shutdown all web servers.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Gets the port number that the web server is running on.
        Returns:
        TCP port number.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the web server.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the web server. Once this method is called, the server cannot be restarted.

      • add

        public void add(org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ContextHandler handler)
        Adds a context handler to the server. Context handlerCollection should be added before the web server is started.
        Parameters:
        handler - context handler.

      • remove

        public void remove(org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ContextHandler handler)
        Removes a context handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - context handler to remove.

      • add

                java.lang.String resource,
                java.lang.String cacheControl)
        Adds a context to serve static documents.
        Parameters:
        context - context path.
        resource - resource path.
        cacheControl - cache control header.

        resource - resource path.

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String context,
                java.io.File dir,
                java.lang.String cacheControl)
        Adds a context to serve static documents.
        Parameters:
        context - context path.
        dir - filesystem path of directory to serve files from.
        cacheControl - cache control header.

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String context,

        Adds a context to serve static documents.

        dir - filesystem path of directory to serve files from.
